StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Mediators of Atherosclerosis in South Asians Living in America (MASALA) Study: Genomics

Person.Organization: NEW YORK UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF MEDICINE

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This work was supported by grants 2R01HL093009 and R01HL149809-01A1 to _Alka Kanaya from the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI), a part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and sequencing was supported by Spectrum Biobank. For publications, written, and/or oral presentations resulting from use of this data, please cite the following information: “The original data description for the [MASALA Study] can be found here: (Clinical Cardiology. 2013; 36(12):713-20.)(PMCID: PMC3947423). The original data used for the analysis in this publication can be found in the NIH database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under the accession number phs______.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s). Only full or expedited approvals are acceptable, and an ANNUAL IRB review is required base on the informed consents from the submitting institution.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, COL)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-COL
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).
Only full or expedited approvals are acceptable, and an ANNUAL IRB review is required base on the informed consents from the submitting institution.
